post.description: Checks whether the Media Service resource name is available. The name must be globally unique.

parameters.name: CheckNameAvailabilityInput
parameters.description: Properties needed to check the availability of a name.

200.description: Success. Returns details about whether a Media Service resource name is available.

value.message: Already in use by another Media Service instance. Please try again with a name that is not likely to be in use.

default.description: CheckNameAvailability of a Media Service failed.

ApiEndpoint.description: The properties for a Media Services REST API endpoint.

majorVersion.description: The version of Media Services REST API.

ApiError.description: The error returned from a failed Media Services REST API call.

error.message: Name availability check is not supported for type Microsoft.Media/mediaservices.

CheckNameAvailabilityInput.description: The request body for CheckNameAvailability API.

name.description: The name of the resource. A name must be globally unique.

type.description: The type of the resource - mediaservices.

CheckNameAvailabilityOutput.description: The response body for CheckNameAvailability API.

value.Message: Already in use by another Media Service instance. Please try again with a name that is not likely to be in use.
The media service name should be between 3 and 24 characters and may contain only lowercase letters and numbers.

NameAvailable.description: Specifies if the name is available.

Reason.description: Specifies the reason if the name is not available.

Message.description: Specifies the detailed reason if the name is not available.

MediaService.description: The properties of a Media Service resource.

MediaServiceCollection.description: The collection of Media Service resources.

MediaServiceProperties.description: The additional properties of a Media Service resource.

apiEndpoints.description: Read-only property that lists the Media Services REST API endpoints for this resource. If supplied on a PUT or PATCH, the value will be ignored.

storageAccounts.description: The storage accounts for this resource.

RegenerateKeyInput.description: The request body for a RegenerateKey API.

keyType.description: The keyType indicating which key you want to regenerate, Primary or Secondary.

RegenerateKeyOutput.description: The response body for a RegenerateKey API.

key.description: The new value of either the primary or secondary key.

location.description: The geographic location of the resource. This must be one of the supported and registered Azure Geo Regions (for example, West US, East US, Southeast Asia, and so forth).

tags.description: Tags to help categorize the resource in the Azure portal.

ServiceKeys.description: The response body for a ListKeys API.

primaryKey.description: The primary key for the Media Service resource.

secondaryKey.description: The secondary key for the Media Service resource.

StorageAccount.description: The properties of a storage account associated with this resource.

id.description: The id of the storage account resource. Media Services relies on tables and queues as well as blobs, so the primary storage account must be a Standard Storage account (either Microsoft.ClassicStorage or Microsoft.Storage). Blob only storage accounts can be added as secondary storage accounts (isPrimary false).

isPrimary.description: Is this storage account resource the primary storage account for the Media Service resource. Blob only storage must set this to false.

SyncStorageKeysInput.description: The request  body for a SyncStorageKeys API.

id.description: The id of the storage account resource.

subscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
subscriptionIdParameter.description: The unique identifier for a Microsoft Azure subscription.

resourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
resourceGroupNameParameter.description: Name of the resource group within the Azure subscription.

apiVersionParameter.name: api-version
apiVersionParameter.description: Version of the API to be used with the client request. Current version is 2015-10-01
